turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You have to go for help.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll wait here.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Will this work?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We'll find out.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I'm not going without you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Get in the boat, Rose.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You jump, I jump, right?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look for something floating. Some debris... wood... anything.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: It's so cold.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I know. I know. Help me, here. Look around.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: It's getting quiet.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Just a few more minutes. It'll take them a while to get the boats organized...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No... don't say your good-byes, Rose. Don't you give up. Don't do it.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I'm so cold.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're going to get out of this... you're going to go on and you're going to make babies and watch them grow and you're going to die an old lady, warm in your bed. Not here. Not this night. Do you understand me?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I can't feel my body.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Rose, listen to me. Listen. Winning that ticket was the best thing that ever happened to me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You must do me this honor... promise me you will survive... that you will never give up... no matter what happens... no matter how hopeless... promise me now, and never let go of that promise.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I promise.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Never let go.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I promise. I will never let go, Jack. I'll never let go.

turns.speaker: LIGHTOLLER
turns.text: I don't think I've ever seen such a flat calm, in 24 years at sea.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Yes, like a mill pond. Not a breath of wind.

turns.speaker: LIGHTOLLER
turns.text: It's make the bergs harder to see, with no breaking water at the base.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Mmmmm. Well, I'm off. Maintain speed and heading, Mr. Lightoller.

turns.speaker: LIGHTOLLER
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: And wake me, of course, if anything becomes in the slightest degree doubtful.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: If your grandma is who she says she is, she was wearing the diamond the day Titanic sank.  And that makes you my new best friend. I will happily compensate you for anything you can tell us that will lead to its recovery.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Wait! Can you give us something go on, here. Like who had access to the safe. What about this Lovejoy guy? The valet. Did he have the combination?

turns.speaker: LIZZY
turns.text: That's enough.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Maybe she wants to make peace with the past.

turns.speaker: LIZZY
turns.text: What past? She has never once, not once, ever said a word about being on the Titanic until two days ago.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Then we're all meeting your grandmother for the first time.

turns.speaker: LIZZY
turns.text: You think she was really there?

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Oh, yeah. Yeah, I'm a believer. She was there.

turns.speaker: LIZZY
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: We were pissin' in the wind the whole time.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Is your stateroom alright?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Yes. Very nice. Have you met my granddaughter, Lizzy? She takes care of me.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: There, that's nice. I have to have my pictures when I travel. And Freddy of course.  Isn't that right, sweetie.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Would you like anything?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I should like to see my drawing.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Louis the Sixteenth wore a fabulous stone, called the Blue Diamond of the Crown, which disappeared in 1792, about the time Louis lost everything from the neck up. The theory goes that the crown diamond was chopped too... recut into a heart-like shape... and it became Le Coeur de la Mer. The Heart of the Ocean. Today it would be worth more than the Hope Diamond.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: It was a dreadful, heavy thing.  I only wore it this once.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: I tracked it down through insurance records... and old claim that was settled under terms of absolute secrecy. Do you know who the claiment was, Rose?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Someone named Hockley, I should imagine.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Nathan Hockley, right. Pittsburgh steel tycoon. For a diamond necklace his son Caledon Hockley bought in France for his fiancee... you... a week before he sailed on Titanic. And the claim was filed right after the sinking. So the diamond had to've gone down with the ship.  See the date?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: It's been 84 years...

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Just tell us what you can --

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: It's been 84 years... and I can still smell the fresh paint. The china had never been used. The sheets had never been slept in.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I can still feel its weight. If you could have felt it, not just seen it...

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Well, that's the general idea, my dear.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Rose, tell us more about the diamond. What did Hockley do with it after that?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I'm afraid I'm feeling a little tired, Mr. Lovett.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Don't come any closer.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: You had it the entire time?!

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: My God, Rose, what's gotten into --

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Mother, may I introduce Jack Dawson.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Charmed, I'm sure.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Rose, this is not a game! Our situation is precarious. You know the money's gone!

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Of course I know it's gone. You remind me every day!

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Your father left us nothing but a legacy of bad debts hidden by a good name. And that name is the only card we have to play.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: I don't understand you. It is a fine match with Hockley, and it will insure our survival.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: How can you put this on my shoulders?

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Do you want to se me working as a seamstress? Is that what you want? Do you want to see our fine things sold at an auction, our memories scattered to the winds? My God, Rose, how can you be so selfish?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: It's so unfair.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Of course it's unfair! We're women. Our choices are never easy.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: Rose, get in the boat!

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Goodbye, mother.

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: Anya!

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Don't you hate people that surprise you? ... I do.  We can't stand here.

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: Anya, I think you're crazy.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Any woman's crazy to feel about a man the way I do about you.

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: I wasn't running out on you. When I got over there-- made my plans--I'd have sent for you.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Then why the sudden exit without even telling me?

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: Do you want the truth, Anya?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: It would be a nice change from you.

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: I had an idea your husband was getting suspicious.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: You're a charming liar. You <U>know</U>, Herbert's too dull to be suspicious about anything--even when I suddenly decided to come to Europe at a few hours' notice--

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: How'd you ever get away with it?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: When I found out you were going I just had an attack of nerves--a few tears--and Herbert was on his way downtown to get my passport ... so who cares ... I'm here with you ... and that's all that matters to me.

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: Sure!

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I never want to go back....

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Here's to Europe!  Couldn't try to look a little less glum, could you?

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: Don't be crazy--I'm tickled to death to see you.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: That's fine--because you're going to see a lot of me ... for the rest of your life.

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: But, Anya, dear! Unless you play we won't have a fourth.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I'm sorry, but you three men can play poker or something.  Shall I see you tomorrow?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Hope we're not intruding.

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: This is Miss Marsh.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Yes--I met Miss Marsh. In fact, she always seems to be turning up in the most unusual circumstances.  What's the matter, Miss Marsh--aren't you feeling well?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Well--shall we go into dinner?

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: I'll join you later.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: And <U>do</U> bring Miss Marsh--  --when she's had time to tidy up a bit.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: So that's your little dancer that you were playing around with in New York.  Oh--there's no accounting for tastes--  Mine, too, seem to be in the gutter.

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: I can explain--

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Sure! You're never at a loss for words.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Don't look so uncomfortable, Lee--it interferes with your good looks. Give me a cigarette.  What did you do--persuade her to come on this voyage with you?

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: Don't talk such bunk! She's one of the acts on the ship. I just ran into her by accident.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Did you muss up her hair by accident, too?

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: You mind your own business! She's an old friend of mine and I like her--what're you going to do about it?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Just make it as difficult as possible for you to see her.

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: I didn't ask you to come away with me--

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Oh--a hundred times--

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: --and I can tell you where to get off.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: And when you do I'll convey your respects by wireless to Herbert.  Take it easy, Lee--no other woman'll ever get you. At least I'm honest when I tell you there must be something pretty low down in me--because I like you.  You're such a swine!

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: Will you leave me alone?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I like touching you--poison ivy.  You'd just been kissing that girl when I came in, hadn't you?

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: Baloney!

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: No, darling, lip rouge--all over your mouth.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: I can think of nothing nicer. It's very kind of you to invite me--

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I'm just commencing to enjoy this trip.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Feeling a little better, I see.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Yes, yes--the air--  --I'm getting plenty of air.  Miss Marsh--Mrs. Rosson.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Thanks. I'll be there. About seven-thirty?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Sooner--if you like.  See you again, I hope.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Good afternoon--

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Glad to see you again.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: I hope so.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: That's a date.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Will you please excuse me? I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: We'll save you a place at our table.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Isn't she lovely?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Yes--and <U>very</U> popular--

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: No--I'm furious!--Nobody seems to do anything about it--

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Why worry? It was insured--how about that swimming lesson I promised you?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: How do you do. Would you care to finish the game? I have a slight earache.  --and it's so noisy up here.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Thanks, no. I despise any form of exercise.  Don't forget we have an engagement for cocktails and cards.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You're Anya Rosson, aren't you? I've heard of you back in New York.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Sorry I can't return the compliment.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You were indiscreet enough to leave your gloves in my apartment one evening--  --and he was gentleman enough to boast <U>why</U> you'd been there and show me a snapshot of you.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I think you do.

turns.speaker: SUMMERS
turns.text: A rare pleasure to meet you, ma'am! Where I come from --out in Montana--we have some pretty women, but I guess if you walked down Main Street they'd turn out the fire brigade.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Montana?

turns.speaker: SUMMERS
turns.text: Lumber, ma'am--spent all my life out there piling up a bank balance--  --and now gosh darn it--"Honest Jack"--that's what they call me--is goin' to see the world.

turns.speaker: SUMMERS
turns.text: --that's what we call double-a grade lumber, ma'am; You don't find a knot in a thousand feet.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Isn't that interesting?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: You'll excuse me.

turns.speaker: SUMMERS
turns.text: Well, it'll have to be poker--but I'm so unlucky in that game.

turns.speaker: SUMMERS
turns.text: Will you pardon me?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: <U>Gladly</U>.

turns.speaker: SUMMERS
turns.text: You're lucky--out my way, in Montana, there's nothing else to do--

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I'm going down to my cabin. I have to send a wireless-- see you later.

turns.speaker: SUMMERS
turns.text: Did you find it?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: No!--Did <U>you</U> take that bracelet?

turns.speaker: SUMMERS
turns.text: No-o!

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Where's Lother?

turns.speaker: MCKINNEY
turns.text: Where'd you get it?

turns.speaker: BALLINGER
turns.text: Lifted it out of a guy's cabin last night.

turns.speaker: MCKINNEY
turns.text: What did you want a gun for?

turns.speaker: BALLINGER
turns.text: Stick-up. Needed dough to get ashore.

turns.speaker: MCKINNEY
turns.text: Is that why you killed Lee Lother?

turns.speaker: BALLINGER
turns.text: Guess again, copper.

turns.speaker: MCKINNEY
turns.text: Get moving--

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Hmm! So am I. If you'll excuse me I have some important unfinished business. I'll see you all later.

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: We'll be expecting you.

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: We haven't any chips, Mr. Brett--Do you mind playing with cash?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Not at all.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Well, I'm off to a pretty good start.

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: If I ever won a pot that large the boat would sink.

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: I should pass, but I'll trail along--I'll take three.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: I'll bet a couple of hundred.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Aces full.

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: And me coming in with two pair--

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: You're coming back--

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: That depends on how mother's feeling. You'll excuse me, gentlemen?

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: How about a little game later?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Fine--I'll be glad to.

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: Could I see you a minute?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Sure!  Excuse me.

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: No gentleman would do that.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: I agree with you--no gentleman, would--But I would--  --especially when my opponents have taken the precaution of marking the cards.

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: In that case--you owe us exactly sixteen hundred dollars.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Oh, no--I played with <U>your</U> cards--in <U>your</U> cabin--at <U>your</U> suggestion--If you've got a kick coming, make it to the Purser.

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: I'm making it to you. If I don't get it by tonight--you'll find it a <U>rough</U> voyage.

turns.speaker: LOTHER
turns.text: And I'll lay odds you got that bracelet.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: I'll lay odds you get a pair of 'em--Why, a high-school kid could take you saps--and another thing--Lay off Sally Marsh.  --"Honest Jack"! One look at your mug and the whole world buttons up its pockets.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I'm so sorry!

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Want to take it back?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I thought you were one of my friends.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: I'd <U>like</U> to be.  Sailing on the <U>Progress?</U>

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Yes--are you?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: I wouldn't miss this boat for a million.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: She looks like a lot of other boats. I grant you she's beautiful.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: I'll say she is!

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Nice lines--

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Yes--

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Like her paint job?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Very much--

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You've got lipstick all over you.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: I could stand some more--

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: --You'll have all the boys tipping their hats to you--  --let me wipe it off.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: No! Don't touch it! I want the <U>world</U> to see my <U>shame</U>.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Where have you been hiding?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Oh--hello!  I got the flowers. That was sweet of you--thank you.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Don't thank me. Do you recognize me without the lipstick?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: So you washed it off!

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: How about giving me another coat?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Good-by.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Wait a minute!--They're dancing in the palm court--

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Good-by!

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: There's soft music--

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: --sorry--got an appointment to play shuffle-board.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Have we?--Well, I'd just as soon play shuffle-board.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: This is great. I'll be able to watch your act every night.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You're not very ambitious, are you?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Oh, yes, I am, because <U>afterwards</U>--up here in the moonlight.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You work too fast for me, young man.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Aw--give a feller a break. My cards are on the table-- I want to know you. How about dining with me tonight?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Never eat before the show.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Well--breakfast?  Lunch?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: This is Mr.--er--

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Brett is the name.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Mr Denby and Mr. McKinney.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Don't stop, nurse--I think I'm going to faint.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You <U>are</U> a lunatic!

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Even Cupid's becoming modern, using medicine balls instead of darts.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: You know, you're not a <U>bad</U>-looking girl. In fact--I think you're lovely.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Keep your eyes on the ball, Mister.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Married?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Nothing to speak of. What is this--third degree?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: I want you to get used to my voice--you're going to hear it a lot.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: What a horrible death! Do you know what you remind me of?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Tell me.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: A little boy that has escaped from his nurse and--

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: --you want to adopt him!--Good for you!

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Isn't she attractive?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Very--your mother?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Don't be a c-a-t.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You asked me to dine with you tonight.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Well, I can't.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Don't rub it in.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: But I'll have cocktails with you.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: At seven-thirty?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Sooner it you like.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Fatal fascination of James Brett wins out.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Wrong again--  But I dislike possessive women.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: See you at seven-thirty in the lounge.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I'll be there--Good-by.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I'm sorry I'm late, but something happened.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: You're forgiven if you don't make dates with anybody except me for the rest of the voyage.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I must say you're persistent--  --it's kind of flattering.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: A little.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Anything I can do?  I'd jump overboard if it'd help you.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Mighty decent of you, pal.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Decent?  I guess any guy could be decent--if you were interested.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: What are you thinking?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: A lot of things I'd like to forget.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: That's funny--so was I.  Guess the ocean makes one sentimental

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: I can't blame the ocean--it's you.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You don't know anything about me. If you did, you probably wouldn't be here.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Don't kid me. I'm in no mood for it.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: For once I'm dead on the level--  --crazy about you!

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Will you take some advice?  If you're looking for romance--count me out--  --if you know what's good for you.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: But--

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: --I know what I'm talking about. I'm no high-school girl looking through a window--reaching for the moon.  Guess I'll be going.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Sally--!

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Let's forget it--can't you see I kind of like you, too ... and I don't want to get involved.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: You mean that?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Don't let's talk about it.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: You said it! How about a little action?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Would you like to take a turn around the deck with me?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Yes--is it all right if I come like this?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: This time I'm really glad you showed up.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Lonesome?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: We'll let it go at that--

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: What, again?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Yes--you know what I've been thinking, Sally?--

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: What?--

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: I think we'll live in Europe after we're married?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I didn't <U>know</U> we were <U>going</U> to be married.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: You didn't?--I guess I forgot to tell you--

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You're a little ahead of yourself--the usual routine would be for you to propose, and if I accept, then you'd give me an engagement ring--

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: I'll give you plenty of rings as soon as I get the stones set--what do you think?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I think we ought to walk.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Good night, Mrs. Brett!

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Good night, idiot!

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I could see you were pining away--

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Oh, that's Mrs. Rosson--remember, you met her yesterday?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Yes--I remember--

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: How well do you know her?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Just met her on the boat--supposed to play bridge with her yesterday--but she wouldn't--so we played poker instead.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Who with?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: A Mr. Summers and a man called Lother.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Oh, you infant! How much did you lose?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Lose?--I won a little--

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: That was the come-on--promise me you won't play with them again--

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: What do you know about them?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Too much--Remember--I warned you about me--  I used to be Lee Lother's girl--

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: You can live that down, can't you?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: He's a con man--crooked as a tree--and I was part of the racket--helped him!  Now--if you have an appointment elsewhere--I'll excuse you!

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: You can't lose me, Sally--I'm no lily myself!

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I'm beginning to think you're a pretty swell guy.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Come on--let's take a swim.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I'll change and be with you in ten minutes.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Make it five.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Seven-fifty. Positively my last offer.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: I'll be waiting on deck.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: I'm going to return the bracelet right now and face the consequences.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Jimmy!

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Well, I'll be--!!!

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Not here--follow me around the shed.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Don't you know better than to talk to me with people around?

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: Oh, putting on the swell, eh?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: I thought you were a smart guy.

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: If I was smart I wouldn't be working my way over on this ship.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: We didn't have enough dough for two tickets, did we?

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: We coulda got two third-class!

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: No bank roll there, boy.  Lucky I could get you signed on--they picked up that Pittsburgh jeweler--made him talk. The heat's on, Shortie--and those Atlantic breezes are going to be mighty welcome.

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: Oh, I'm not squawkin', but I'm not used to working and it's a bad habit to get into.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: It'll never hurt you---Got any money?

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: A dollar seventy and I'm gonna keep it!

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: No, you're not. Give me that dollar seventy.

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: I'll give you half of it.  Here's seventy cents.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Nix, the law!

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: Yes, sir!--I will, sir--Certainly, sir!

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: He's a colored man in chauffeur's uniform carrying a basket of fruit.

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: I'll watch for him, sir.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Quick, let me have that money. I'm broke and I'll need it for tips.

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: Oh, no--You're not gonna give my hard-earned money away.

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: You're a wise guy--Gimme back--

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Shortie, look!

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: You don't think--?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Looks like he's taking a trip--see the baggage? The only time they ever picked me up, McKinney walked through the room while they were grilling--let's see how good his memory is.

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: Yer lucky I'm here at all. I tell you, Jimmy--my feet'll never hold out.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Stop squawking! You were doing this job on a ship four years ago when I first picked you up, weren't you?

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: Yeah--but high livin's made me soft.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: How're the tips?

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: A dollar forty.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: I'll need it--gave my last buck to the bedroom steward.

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: Not a chance.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Come on--  I'll promote a card game, and we'll be sitting pretty.

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: Until then--the dollar forty stays with me.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Is that a nice way to talk to a pal?

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: Don't let money spoil a beautiful friendship. Look at these here telegrams to be delivered! This ain't a job-- it's a marathon.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Oh, Shortie!--  --there's a girl on this ship--

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: --there's thousands of 'em!

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: A thousand? She's one in a million--right off the top of the rosebush!

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: This is a business trip!

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: She was wearing a white dress with a cute, black hat-- and carrying a bag with S. M. on it.  Funny--her name's not on the passenger list.

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: Maybe she's in the show--One of the troupers--did you ever think of that?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Why <U>didn't</U> I think of that?--I am going to scout around and see if I can find her.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Just a minute, steward--haven't you forgotten something?

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: No, sir?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: My change.

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: Change?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: A dollar forty--out of the two dollars I gave you.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Shortie!--you know my motto?

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: Pleasure first if it don't interfere with business.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Right!--but it doesn't have to apply to you--Keep your eyes open for anybody wearing a lot of cracked ice and give me the office.

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: Now you're talkin'!

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Inspector McKinney.

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: Are you screwy?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: I fell in his arms--Couldn't resist it.

turns.speaker: SHORTIE
turns.text: You know where that sense of humor's goin' to get you one of these days--
